alert.note: Alert for Austin; Brazos; Burleson; Washington (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 1:10PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN AUSTIN...BURLESON... NORTHWESTERN GRIMES...BRAZOS...WESTERN WASHINGTON AND SOUTHWESTERN MADISON COUNTIES THROUGH 200 PM CDT... At 110 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles southeast of Cameron to near Paige to 6 miles southwest of Rosanky. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... College Station, Bryan, Brenham, Caldwell, Shelby, Somerville, Snook, Kurten, Burton, Wixon Valley, Lake Somerville Dam, Lake Somerville State Park & Trailway, Kyle Field, Bryan Utilities Lake, Carmine, Lyons, Deanville, Independence, Quarry, and Chriesman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
